trees.name: Moringa
trees.description: Known as the 'Miracle Tree,' moringa is fast-growing, drought-resistant, and requires minimal water. It helps capture carbon dioxide and improves soil quality.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Water regularly, but it's drought-tolerant.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Egyptian Acacia
trees.description: Acacia trees are native to Egypt and excel in arid regions. They prevent desertification, stabilize soil, and absorb CO2.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained, sandy soil.
Watering: Low water needs once established.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to remove dead branches and shape the tree.

trees.name: Tamarisk
trees.description: Tamarisk is highly drought-resistant, thrives in saline soils, and helps combat desertification and CO2 reduction.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Tolerates saline and poor soil.
Watering: Minimal once established.
Mulching: Mulch to conserve soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to manage size and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Date Palm
trees.description: Date palms thrive in arid climates and help reduce greenhouse gases. They provide shade and produce dates.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed during dry spells.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Remove dead fronds and trim to maintain shape.

trees.name: Jojoba
trees.description: Jojoba is a drought-resistant tree with deep roots that help conserve water. It also reduces CO2 and prevents desertification.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained, sandy soil.
Watering: Low water needs once established.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to manage size and shape.

trees.name: Sycamore Fig
trees.description: Native to Egypt, the Sycamore Fig is resilient to dry conditions and helps provide shade, improve air quality, and support wildlife.
care: Location: Full sun to partial shade.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering, especially during dry periods.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Olive Tree
trees.description: Olive trees are highly drought-tolerant, excellent for carbon sequestration, and can thrive in Egypt’s Mediterranean climate.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed, especially in dry spells.
Mulching: Mulch to conserve moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and improve fruit production.

trees.name: Lebanese Cedar
trees.description: Lebanese Cedar trees are effective in carbon sequestration and reforestation efforts, and they are resilient in cooler areas of Egypt.
care: Location: Full sun to partial shade.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed, especially in dry periods.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Minimal pruning needed; shape as necessary.

trees.name: Carob Tree
trees.description: Carob trees are ideal for arid regions, helping with carbon sequestration and soil restoration. Their pods are used for food.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained, sandy soil.
Watering: Low water needs once established.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to manage size and shape.

trees.name: Eucalyptus
trees.description: Eucalyptus trees are fast-growing, drought-resistant, and absorb large amounts of CO2. They also help prevent soil erosion.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed during dry periods.
Mulching: Mulch to conserve soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Baobab
trees.description: Baobab trees store water in their trunks and are highly adapted to dry climates. They capture CO2 and play a role in the water cycle.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Minimal once established.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Neem Tree
trees.description: Neem trees are resilient in poor soil conditions and sequester carbon effectively. They also have medicinal properties and can be used as a natural pesticide.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Low water needs once established.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain size and remove dead branches.

trees.name: African Mahogany
trees.description: African Mahogany thrives in hot, dry climates, absorbs significant CO2, and is used in reforestation projects. Its wood is highly valuable.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed during dry spells.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Casuarina
trees.description: Casuarina trees grow quickly and help control soil erosion. They are effective in carbon sequestration and improve soil fertility by fixing nitrogen.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed during dry spells.
Mulching: Mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to maintain shape and remove dead branches.

trees.name: Pomegranate
trees.description: Pomegranate trees are drought-tolerant and thrive in Egypt’s climate. They help absorb CO2 and are valuable in agroforestry systems.
care: Location: Full sun.
Soil: Well-drained, nutrient-rich soil.
Watering: Regular watering needed, especially during dry periods.
Mulching: Use mulch to retain soil moisture.
Pruning: Prune to enhance fruit production and remove dead branches.
